alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:27PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Fergus, southwestern Blaine and east central Chouteau Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 825 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm clustered near 15 miles northwest of Winifred, or 39 miles southeast of Big Sandy, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winifred, Judith Landing and Iliad. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall with these storms may lead to minor localized flooding, especially in low lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
